A low density of scentless chamomile was observed in this area (six total plants). All plants were pulled by the EI at the time of the assessment, however, further monitoring for this species should occur in subsequent years.
Recommendation(s): Monitor for scentless chamomile growth in 2015 and control if required.

Erosion issue observed at the open water pond.  Beaver dam was extended onto the right-of-way, which overflowed causing the erosion along the slope in this area (Plate 6, Appendix B). Slope currently under repair. Temporary erosion controls have been installed to avoid sedimentation of the wetland.  Additional repairs are scheduled to commence February 2015. The grade will be established, erosion controls will be installed and the area will be seeded.

One individual western Jacob’s-ladder (SU) was observed on July 30, 2014.

Erosion has occurred at the diversion berm located mid/lower slope on the north side of the watercourse causing a break in the diversion berm (Plate 10, Appendix B) in two spots. This was repaired by the EI during the assessment, however, further monitoring should occur to ensure stability of the slope Repairs scheduled for completion in February 2015. The grade will be re-established, erosion controls will be repaired and the slope we be reseeded.

Low vegetation establishment was observed on both the north and south sides of this watercourse. No erosion issues observed. Sediment fencing required to remain in place.
Recommendation(s): Seed as warranted and monitor vegetation establishment and slope stability in 2015, reseed if required. Removal of sediment fencing to be reassessed if required
